meanings.definition: To emit a steady light without flame
meanings.sent1: The fireflies glow in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The lantern glows softly in the night.
meanings.sent3: The nightlight decided to glow brighter than the moon.
meanings.sent4: Her smile made her whole face glow with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The stars above seemed to glow with a magical light.

meanings.sent1: The soft glow of the candle filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The city skyline had a warm glow at sunset.
meanings.sent3: The glow of the fire made everyone feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The glow of the sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The glow of the campfire danced in the darkness.

meanings.definition: To have a warm, reddish color
meanings.sent1: The sky began to glow with the colors of dawn.
meanings.sent2: The embers of the fire started to glow as they burned.
meanings.sent3: The cheeks of the child started to glow with embarrassment.
meanings.sent4: The horizon began to glow with the approaching sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the trees seemed to glow in the autumn sunlight.

meanings.definition: A feeling of warmth and happiness
meanings.sent1: The memory of that day always brings a warm glow to my heart.
meanings.sent2: The laughter of children filled the room with a joyful glow.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift brought a glow of happiness to her face.
meanings.sent4: The kind words from a friend can bring a glow to your day.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fireplace filled the room with a comforting glow.
